--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, "Adam Fisk" <adamfisk@...> wrote=
:
>
> I'm trying to use SurtPrefixedDecideRule to run a relatively simple
>=
 crawl.  Here's the XML from my order file:
> 
> <newObject
> class=3D"org.=
archive.crawler.deciderules.SurtPrefixedDecideRule"
> name=3D"acceptIfSurtP=
refixed">
>   <string name=3D"decision">ACCEPT</string>
>   <string name=3D=
"surts-source-file"/>
>   <boolean name=3D"seeds-as-surt-prefixes">true</bo=
olean>
>   <string name=3D"surts-dump-file"/>
> </newObject>
> 
> In my und=
erstanding, I can then just use SURT prefixes in my seeds
> file.  My seeds=
 file contains the following:
> 
> +http://(org,example,
> 
> When I run th=
is, though, I get the log warning below when it's
> processng the seeds fil=
e, apparently indicating it's not expecting a
> SURT here.  Should I just s=
pecify http://example.org in the seeds,
> allowing it to derive the SURT ab=
ove?  Or maybe I should use an
> external SURT file?   
> 
> Thanks very mu=
ch.
> 
> -Adam
>
